author: geekship
title: SOIL: E-Commerce legal templates
description: Les réglementations régionales en matière de commerce électronique peuvent être difficiles, notamment en ce qui concerne les écosystèmes cryptographiques. Les législateurs ne comprennent pas l'auditabilité.

f6_assessments.q0: E-commerce will need a legal framework to operate in per region. The proposer has provided this insight. But it is unclear in the proposal how this framework would make a difference with current E-commerce legislation without a lobbying factor to influence regulatory laws. One cannot go without the other.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is part of a series of proposals in Fund 7. This one serves as a means for reaching out to people and getting the project known in the community so the proposer can assemble a team. Nonetheless, the proposal should receive an assessment in this state as it would provide guidance to the proposer. The proposer has experience in software development, but not in the field of law. So the team needs to be expanded by lawyers with legislative knowledge from every region the template would operate in. The requested budget is set to 42 USD, which is unrealistic for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan is currently not detailed enough to clarify how these templates would come into fruition. A general overview in the proposer's series of Fund 7 proposals would improve the ability of determining how these templates would be deployed. I'd suggest creating a website with information on how these proposals interlink with one another, containing all the auditable variables and mentioning these variables per proposal again in the proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of legal templates is really good as we all know professional legal consultations are really expensive. Unluckily, the proposer didn't have time to finish this document so we don't know the details. Good luck, I highly recommend sticking to this topic in next Catalyst Fund
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer is a web developer which will clearly help in building the website. However, a legal advisor would be really beneficial in such project; on later stages maybe some hired local legal experts
f6_assessments.q2: There is no details given. But as I said before, I highly recommend sticking to this topic in next Catalyst Fund.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on creating a template for E-Commerce with regional regulations built-in, with emphasis on auditability and compliance. I am convinced by the problem statement but: (1) it would be better if some explanation was provided; and (2) some points still quite unclear [ex: "regional" - there is multi-level of "the region": provinces inside a country or some neighbor nations]. The proposer has failed to show what he wants to solve. In the section of "Big Picture", the problem was not clearly defined, instead of that, a token-related content [creating, burning,...]was provided. The proposed solution is not clearly described [without any specific roadmap/timeline and KPIs, budget breakdown, ...]. As a result, evidence of addressing this challenge or showing the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole can not be seen. Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is briefly described, but understandable, shows suitable skill, and experiences for implementation, with an external link [LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/martin-vavrovic-9617514a/] for verification. As a result, the profile convinces me of feasibility in certain aspects. On the contrary, the plan was not well-prepared, without the budget allocation, specific roadmap/timelines, KPIs/metrics, and risk management. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: For better transparency, (1) Roadmap/timeline (with KPIs), (2) Budget allocation, (3) Risk management should be provided. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0: The idea about E-Commerce legal templates and using taxes to have agreement of governance is innovative. However this proposal is just a draft to demonstrate idea, so it's not completed yet and we can expect to have this idea develop more in the future (or at Fund8).
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal is just a draft idea so it need more information and plan to be able to implemented successfully. The proposal need to include clear roadmap/ action plan with phases/milestones in it. I'm looking forward for your proposal in Fund8.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is just a draft idea so it need more information to be more auditable. The proposal need to include clear roadmap/ action plan and KPIs with set clear number for each goal so that the project can be easy to track progress and measure success.
